docs.title: Giovanni Misitano
Giovanni Misitano, PhD
docs.text:
We have all kinds of fancy AI tools that can predict this and that, but are complete black-boxes for a layman. When it comes to making actual decisions based on the output of these tools, we lack decision-support and grounds to justify our solutions. My research can help us make informed and explicable decisions when multiple conflicting criteria are to be considered without a clear 'best' solution. I am all about providing support and tools to decision makers (domain experts) to make the best possible decisions given their expertise, preferences, and the available data and information. I do not care much about replacing human decision makers, but I do think we can do a much better job at supporting decision makers across a plethora of different domains, without relying on black-boxes.

Stop guessing and start optimizing—and do it explainably!

docs.title: About me
docs.text:
I am currently employed as a post-doctoral researcher at the University of Jyväskylä, Finland, in the Multiobjectove Optimization Group. I specialize in methods and tools for multiobjective optimization. These methods can be applied anywhere where data is available, there are conflicting objectives to be optimized, and there are decision makers with relevant domain expertise. That is, pretty much anywhere these days! My current work focuses on researching decision support tools, more specifically, interactive multiobjective optimization methods, that are explainable and transparent to decision makers and stakeholders alike. I also have a deep interest in developing user interfaces, and the user experience in general from a cognition perspective.

I am also a main contributor and maintainer of DESDEO. DESDEO is an open-source Python framework for interactive multiobjective optimization. Our research group is currently overhauling the framework, working towards a ''DESDEO 2.0.'' This version will be a full-stack solution, with a backend containing the algorithmic implementations of various interactive multiobjective optimization methods, both multi-criteria decision-making methods and stochastic evolutionary methods; an web application programming interface (API) with database and user session management to connect the backend over the web to existing and custom interfaces; and a frontend, a graphical web-based interface designed by us. This is a huge endeavor, but it is fueled by our group's decased of collective experience in researching and developing multiobjective optimization methods.

DESDEO can offer huger opportunities in the future for academics and industry in the future for tackling data-based problems with multiple and conflicting objectives functions to be either minimized or maximized. DESDEO can very much function as the connecting piece between all the fancy AI tools available these days, and making actual decisions based on the tools' output.

Check out the development of the new version of DESDEO here. In the documentation, there is also a primer on what multiobjective optimization is, check the primer here.

Note

Everything under the desdeo2 branch is under active development and subject to sudden, and possibly drastic, changes. We will release a more stable version going into the latter half of the year 2024.

docs.title: Activities and Rewards
Positions
EURO Representative
docs.text:
The Finnish Operations Research Society, Association of European Operational Research Societies, 2024, ongoing

As representative, I represent the Finnish Operations Research Society on an international level. I take part in the yearly board meeting of the Association of European Operational Research Societies (EURO). I hold the right to vote in the yearly board meeting of EURO.

docs.title: Treasurer
docs.text:
The Finnish Operations Research Society, 2024, ongoing

As treasurer, I am responsible for the finances of the society. I am also a member of the society's current board.

docs.title: President
docs.text:
The Finnish Operations Research Society, 2023

As president, I was in charge calling board meetings and making sure the board promoted the interests of operation research researchers, practitioners, and enthusiast residing in Finland. I was also the main coordinator of the FORS50 conference, which was held at the University of Jyväskylä in honor of the 50-year-anniversary of the society.

docs.title: Rewards and Nominations
Award for best pitch related to information and communication technology or telecommunications
docs.text:
Millenium Graduate Student Contest, 2022

The reward was given by the Nokia Foundation, and consisted of a certificate and cash reward of 5000 euros. The finalists gave the pitch live during the Millennium Innovation Forum 2022. The pitch I gave during the event can be viewed on YouTube.

docs.title: Grants
Full scholarship from the Vilho, Yrjö and Kalle Väisälä Fund
docs.text:
Finnish Academy of Science and Letters, 2020

The scholarship consisted of 28,600 euros to work full time on my PhD. The grant covered a year's worth of full-time work.

docs.title: Education and Teaching
Education
PhD, Computational Science
docs.text:
University of Jyväskylä (2024) Link to thesis

Title of my PhD thesis: Enhancing the decision-support capabilities of interactive multiobjective optimization with explainability. The thesis was supervised by Prof. Kaisa Miettinen and Dr. Bekir Afsar. In my thesis, I explore the concept of explainability, inspired by explainability in explainable artificial intelligence, when applied to interactive multiobjective optimization methods to better support decision makers.

docs.title: MSc, Computer Science
docs.text:
University of Jyväskylä (2020) Link to thesis

I completed my masters specializing in computational science. My master's thesis was supervised by Prof. Kaisa Miettinen and Dr. Jussi Hakanen. In my thesis, I implemented a new kind of interactive multiojective optimization methods, which is able to learn a preference model of a decision maker during an interactive process. I applied belief rule-based systems as a machine learning model to learn the preference model of a decision maker.

docs.title: BSc, Physics
docs.text:
University of Jyväskylä (2016) Link to thesis

I completed my bachelor of physics focusing on experimental underground physics. My bachelor thesis (written in Finnish) was supervised by Prof. Jouni Suhonen. In my thesis, I surveyed the ongoing experiments at the LNGS (Laboratori Nazionali del Gran Sasso), which study the double beta-decay of various nuclei. I also compted the experimental upper limit of the neutrino based on the experiments' results.

docs.title: Teaching
TIES5830: Course on Data-driven Optimization and Decision Making
docs.text:
Lecturer, University of Jyväskylä, 2024

I have prepared and gave lectures during the course related to data-driven interactive multiobjective optimization focusing on practical aspects and how to best support decision makers in tackling multiobjective optimization problems.

docs.title: Physics Student Laboratory
docs.text:
Teaching Assistant, University of Jyväskylä, 2016 - 2024

I have worked as a teaching assistant in the student laboratory of the Physics Department of the University of Jyvsäskylä. I have supervised both bachelor and master level student in various kinds of physics experiments, which are part of different physics courses. I have also been the corresponding teacher in grading and supervising a larger laboratory assignment, where students must write a full report on a physics experiment and its results.

docs.title: TIES598: Nonlinear Multiobjective Optimization Course
docs.text:
Lecturer, University of Jyväskylä, 2023

During the course, I prepared and delivered lectures on data-driven interactive multiobjective optimization. The focus was on practical applications and providing optimal support for decision makers in addressing multiobjective optimization challenges.

docs.title: COM1: Interactive Multiobjective Optimization: Applications and Tools to Support Decision Making
docs.text:
Lecturer, The 31st Jyväskylä Summer School, University of Jyväskylä, 2022

During the two-week summer school course, I prepared and delivered two whole-day lectures on interactive multiobjective optimization. I was also a teacher in the practical sessions during the whole duration of the course, where we focused on utilzing the DESDEO framework to model and and solve multiobjective optimization problems.

docs.title: Tools and best practices for scientific software development
docs.text:
Lecturer, University of Jyväskylä, 2022

I was a lecturer at a local CoreRefinery workshop at the University of Jyväskylä. During the course, we taught the course participants about practicalities and good practices when developing code, focusing especially on version control utilizing git, and collaborative softwrae developing on GitHub.

docs.title: Various introductory and advanced bachelor-level physics courses
docs.text:
Teaching Assistant, Lecturer, University of Jyväskylä, 2015 - 2020

Various physics courses. I have been working as a teaching assistant, occasionally as a lecturer as well, in around a dozen university physics courses, both at an introductory and at an advanced level.

docs.title: Research Experience
Research Positions
Multiobjective Optimization Group, University of Jyväskylä, Finland
docs.text:
Post-doctoral Researcher, 2024, ongoing

I am working in the Research Council of Finland funded project DESIDES. My main research interest is continuing the line of work I established in my doctoral thesis, where I study and apply the concept of explainability in interactive multiobejective optimization methods.

docs.title: Multiobjective Optimization Group, University of Jyväskylä, Finland
docs.text:
Doctoral Researcher, 2020 - 2024

Working on my doctoral thesis and developing the DESDEO framework. My thesis work was about applying and exploring the concept of explainability, as it is known in explainable artificial intelligence, to interactive multiobjective optimization methods. The goal of the research was to improve the decision-support capabilities of interactive multiobjective optimization methods.

docs.title: Multiobjective Optimization Group, University of Jyväskylä, Finland
docs.text:
Research Assistant, 2019 - 2020

I mainly worked on my master's thesis and on DESDEO, the open source Python software framework for interactive multiobjective optimization. Others tasks involved web-development and supporting the research group members in various technical tasks.

docs.title: CERN, Switzerland
docs.text:
Trainee, summer of 2018

I worked on building deep neural networks to predict particle trajectories in the CMS (compact muon solenoid) detector. I utilized Keras to build and train a deep convoluted neural network, and utilized real experiment data to train the model utilizing supervised learning.

docs.title: Center for Underground Physics, Finland
docs.text:
Trainee, summer of 2017

In the C14 experiment, I worked on signal analysis of data produced by photo-multiplier tubes, and conducted practical hands-on work with various apparatuses related to the experiment. In the EMMA experiment, I worked one basic upkeep and maintenance work, including the setup of a working gas circulation system for a set of pixel matrix detectors utilizing very limited resources.

docs.title: LNGS (*Laboratori Nazionali del Gran Sasso), Italy
docs.text:
Trainee, summer of 2016

I was part of the DAMA collaboration. I worked on the maintenance of various experiments in the DAMA project. I also completed a project involving computer vision and machine learning, where I built a program to read the output of a webcam and infer the digits on a 8-segment temperature gauge.

docs.title: Research Projects
DESIDES
docs.text:
Research Council of Finland, 2023 - ongoing, project id: 355346

I am in charge of one of the three work packages of the project. In the work package, I continue to research the concept and application of explainable and interactive multiobjective optimization, a topic I explored in my doctoral thesis.

docs.title: Logistics order-supply chain modelling and optimization
docs.text:
University of Jyväskylä, Tietoevry, 2023 - ongoing

Modelling and solving multiobjective optimization problems related to order-supply chains. Due to confidential reasons, no more details can be given at this time.

docs.title: DAEMON
docs.text:
Research Council of Finland, 2019 - 2023, project id: 322221

I kept contributing to the DESDEO framework, focusing on the development of web-based user interfaces for interactive multiobjective optimization. The work led to publications, where the interfaces have been utilized to conduct user studies to evaluate the decision-support capabilities of various interactive multiobjective optimization methods. I also contributed to studies related to lot-sizing, and researching the semantic distances of icons in user interfaces for interactive multiobjective optimization methods.

docs.title: DESDEO
docs.text:
Research Council of Finland, 2015 - 2019, project id: 287496

I contributed to the DESDEO framework, spearheading its re-implementation. I focused on the tools to model multiobjective optimization problems, and on implementing scalarization-based interactive multiobjective optimization methods.
